definition: to protect/to defend/to guard against/to prevent

(of the sun) to shine on/to bask in (the sunshine)/to dry (clothes, grain etc) in the sun/(fig.) to expose and share (one's experiences and thoughts) on the Web (loanword from "share")/(coll.) to give the cold shoulder to

sentences.english: Theoretically, the best sunscreen has the highest SPF number.
sentences.chinese: 理論上來說，最好的防曬霜的防曬係數也就最高。

sentences.english: Theoretically, the best sunscreen has the highest SPF number.
sentences.chinese: 理論上來說，最好的防曬霜的防曬係數也就最高。

sentences.english: Wearing sun-protective clothing is a good idea.
sentences.chinese: 穿上具有防曬的衣服是個不錯的主意。

sentences.english: That the sunscreen is a kind of beauty care products.
sentences.chinese: 認爲防曬霜是一種美容保養品。

sentences.english: She smoothed suntan lotion over her arms.
sentences.chinese: 她輕輕地把防曬油塗在胳膊上。

sentences.english: Grab your shades and your sunblock.
sentences.chinese: 帶上你的墨鏡和防曬霜。

sentences.english: Many people use sun hats to help them avoid sunshine.
sentences.chinese: 太陽帽是許多人夏天防曬的必備用品之一。

sentences.english: Don't forget your beach shoes, sun hat, and sun screen!
sentences.chinese: 不要忘記你的沙灘鞋，闊邊太陽帽，和防曬油。

sentences.english: Here are the caps. The sun-block is on the cabinet over there.
sentences.chinese: 這邊是帽女，防曬油在那邊的櫃架上。

sentences.english: Stay out of the sun, or use sunscreen and UV-blocking lip balm.
sentences.chinese: 避免接觸陽光或者塗防曬霜，或者防紫外線潤脣膏。

sentences.english: So, suntan is a condition showing skin damage.
sentences.chinese: 所以，防曬是皮膚損傷的條件顯示。

sentences.english: May I have some sunblock please?
sentences.chinese: 請給我一些防曬乳好嗎？

sentences.english: If you don't wear sunscreen, you are apt to get a sunburn.
sentences.chinese: 如果你沒有擦防曬，你很可能會曬黑。

sentences.english: I want the higher SPF of actual sunscreen and the stronger moisturizer of the lotion.
sentences.chinese: 我既想要防曬係數高又要保溼效果好。

sentences.english: Or wondering whether you should use sunscreen at all?
sentences.chinese: 或者懷疑壓根就不該使用防曬霜？

definition: to remove makeup/(old) to take off formal dress and ornaments
to go out/to leave home/to go on a journey/away from home/(of a woman) to get married
to take good care of (or conserve) one's health/to keep in good repair/to maintain/maintenance
to sunbathe/to tan/to get sunburnt/to expose unfair practices (on a consumer protection website)
